reviewText: While this is certainly no MGM film production, it's a great way for math teachers to incorporate kinesthetic instruction into the classroom experience.  Done by a Colorado math teacher who's been using the techniques he describes in the video for decades, the video is a relatively short and easy to understand labor of love that gives teachers the tools to begin teaching geometry formulas through kinesthetic instruction right away. Of course, it's not for all students, but I found it to be enjoyable for most students and more than worth its weight in gold.  It's also great for math team professional development training...
